intro: Stenostelma eustegioides, commonly known as the narrow-stemmed thistle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust, spiny leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with dark green, lanceolate leaves that have a rough, hairy texture. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in dense clusters, and bloom during the summer months. Stenostelma eustegioides is adapted to survive in dry environments, with deep roots and reduced leaf surface to minimize water loss.
